name: Hilton Leicester

reviews.text: It's true that it is tricky to locate the entrance to the car park but otherwise this hotel is excellent. The staff are friendly and attentive. The kids loved the pool,tub and steam room. We had dinner and breakfast, both terrific. Our family room was great, spacious and clean, two double beds and a sofa bed. Beds very comfortable. Sky Sports in our room. The kids can't wait to come back here!!
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: We stayed on a stay and play deal with our family. We were very pleased and found it great value for money. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Guest areas clean and tidy. We were a little disappointed with the room. It just seemed to need a little tlc. Chairs and carpet stained, writing desk broken. Some parts of the room were lovely and clean others quite dirty ie on top of plug sockets, light switches, windowsills. Room quite warm as unable to open window more than a few inches and no air con. Pool and leisure facilities brilliant and ideally situated just off motorway. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Lovely breakfast!!

reviews.text: The staff were great, always very hospitable and tentative. Its such a shame that the hotel itself is so weathered and worn. The bar area and the lobby clearly receive a lot of more attention when it comes to maintaining standards and the Costa coffee bar is a nice touch before setting off for a long drive home whether you are on business or on your way home from a holiday. I didn't appreciate the £4 parking charge for residents either!
reviews.title: In desperate need of renovation

reviews.text: Great Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Break

reviews.text: Had a family room on the great value deal of bed, breakfast and free entry for whole family to 3 local attractions.
reviews.title: Hilton only by name

reviews.text: Had a very enjoyable night's stay here with my children and some friends. Enjoyed a nice meal in the bar area - until we discovered the price of the wine! Pool lovely and breakfast superb. Would recommend but don't drink wine.
reviews.title: Lovely experience

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the M1 and not too far from the city centre about 15-20 mins drive. Very nice location and nice breakfast buffet as well. Will recommend for all business workers around the J21 area.
reviews.title: Great stuff and nice buffet breakfast

reviews.text: Good hotel based on the gym and location. Staff ok but unable to deal with more rowdy customers (for anyone who works in the area, you too will have suffered the horror that is sharing the hotel with anyone from British Gas - I have never seen so many drunk and disorderly people in my life but BG seem oblivious). Hotel rooms are ok but tired, decoration is shabby, showers/baths are bit ramshackle and water pressure poor. Living Well is great though if you are travelling for work during the summer holidays be warned, they have an offer of 4 nights with entry to 3 attractions which means that children (yes, I have 2) spend their time running up and down the corridors shouting and screaming. Front of house do nothing as do the management. Not ideal and I live here around 2-4 days a week. Lucky me.
reviews.title: Tired but little option
Great Hilton; if a little spread out!
reviews.text: Stayed here with my team for one night - it is a long walk from reception to some of the rooms, but worth it! You walk past the health cub to get to some of the rooms (which is open 24 hours). Our room had two double beds and a decent sized bathroom. There were three chairs in the room as well, all that was missing was a fridge. The lobby in this hotel is fantastic, with a lot of seating and outdoor tables as well. Don't be put off by the exterior of the building; the interior is fantastic. Breakfast was great and staff were very helpful throughout

Stayed here one night as part of the stay play promotion. Couldn,t fault the staff and the breakfast but the beds are the worst i have come across!The worst night sleep i have had in any hotel .Any movement and it sounds like world war 3. Staying in a family room with 2 kids was not enjoyable because of it. Also rooms very hot, perhaps in need of an upgrade to aircon? Overall if its somewhere to get your head down for the night then goto premier inn. Beds there are heaven in comparison!
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: We stay there for two night. When we arrived the hotel, we thought it was average.It is not really new. But it was a quite good place with children. When we are at breakfast, we realized that everyone has children.We also stayed holiday inn in central leicester. So I can compare.
reviews.title: good with children

reviews.text: The room size: Room was better at hilton and bigger.
reviews.title: Definately visit

reviews.text: The swimming pool: Hilton was better and bigger
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast: Hilton had more selection but I am foreigner and english breakfast is always heavy.....Bread selection was quite good for uk standard.
reviews.title: Leicester Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: also hilton has some garden outside with ducks, so my son really enjoyed.
reviews.title: Good value weekend base for a curry

reviews.text: I stayed with the family at Hilton (once again),we hired the double double deluxe. The room was spacious, modern and nicely decorated with all mod cons and extra sockets. The staff kindly moved us closer to the pool on request- superb service.
reviews.title: Comfortable Luxury

reviews.text: The pool is cleaned regularly, is not very busy at the weekends, and my kids loved spending time in it.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay in a family room

reviews.text: The breakfasts are varied ranging from traditional hot food to fruit salads and cereal.We live it!
reviews.title: Hilton leicester review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to the M1, this is a highly recommended hotel in Leicester. We visit regularly if we are at Twin Lakes Park or the Animal Park nearby.
reviews.title: friendly hotel

reviews.text: I attended a wedding here some years back (which was very good), but this was my first overnight stay.
reviews.title: Family wedding

description: Stay at the Hilton Leicester hotel, 3 miles from the city center, just off junction 21 of the M1. Unwind in the gym, pool, restaurant and bar. Do business in one of 10 meeting rooms for 2-150. The hotel is 25 minutes' drive from Nottingham East Midlands Airport. Indulge in traditional cuisine at Flavours restaurant, a light lunch and cool drink in the Hilton Leicester hotel's Court Bar and coffee and sandwiches in Caffe Cino. Unwind in the LivingWell Health Club, swim in the indoor pool, work out in the gym and relax in the sauna.
